fields.name: restaurant_recommendations
fields.text:
This place is a handy guide for places to eat/drink that people know of in Amsterdam for the benefit of newbies and those looking for new things.  Places are listed with rough geographical area, with a descriptor of what makes it good (amazing tapas, good place to take parents when they're in town, etc). If you find a new place, add it to the list!

Searching for new restaurants by neighbourhood, price, type, etc: [iens](http://www.iens.nl/)

## Jordaan / Northern Canal Belt

###Food

* Los Pilones (Eerste Anjeliersdwarsstraat 4): Tex-Mex restaurant, apparently the best in Amsterdam. Generously-portioned margaritas. Two other locations in town too.
* Greenwoods Cafe (Singel 103): Perfect brunch place (esp. if your British/American idea of breakfast involves things like Eggs Benedict or an omelet), has lunch stuff as well, outdoor seating when the weather's nice.  They also do high British tea in the afternoons.
* Spanjer en van Twist (Leliegracht 60): When the weather's good tables are put out on the canal and it is wonderful.  Typical Dutch restaurant fare but tasty, great weekly ravioli.
* Brasserie Vlaming (Prinsengracht 193A): Great place to take parents or on a special occasion etc (~€20 per plate), pricier than usual but Yvette's favorite food in Amsterdam.  Belgian-style, never had anything less than amazing here.  Reservations highly recommended especially on weekends.
* Tasca Belotta (Herenstraat 22): Excellent Spanish tapas.
* De Reiger (Nieuwe Leliestraat 34A): Very tasty food, especially the ribs!
* Purna (Hartenstraat 29): Indian food!
* Seasons (Herenstraat 16): As the name implies, a restaurant whose menu takes into account the seasons.  Good for special occasions as a set menu is €29 for 2 courses, €33 for 3 (as of late 2013), but very nice kitchen and good service.
* Bistrot Neuf (Haarlemmerstraat 9): Classy French restaurant.
* Tales and Spirits (Lijnbaanssteeg 5): Fun restaurant with good (but pricey) food and really great drinks. Plates are small so order a few. 
* Villa Zeezicht (Torensteeg 7): Cute little cafe on Singel. Fantastic apple pie -- get it with cinnamon icecream. Can get very busy on sunny afternoons.

###Drink

* Proeflokaal Arendsnest (Herengracht 90): 30 Dutch beers on tap and 200 in bottles (Dutch beer ONLY!). Yvette's favourite place for beers. Most taps change very regularly -- ask the very knowledgeable bar staff for something in your favourite style, and they will bring you something delicious.  Alas no food beyond cheese etc.
* Vesper (Vinkenstraat 57): Very classy cocktail bar with delicious but expensive cocktails.

##Nieuwmarkt

###Food
* Los Pilones has a location here.
* Tibetan Restaurant (Lange Niezel 24): Good place for vegetarians.

### Drink
* Wynand Fockink (Pijlsteeg 31): Dutch distillery with tasty liquors and jenevers. The place is tiny and hidden away in an alley.


## Rembrandtplein

###Food

* Cafe Szmulewicz (Bakkerstraat 12): Between main square and the Amstel. One of those places filled with locals instead of tourists, and for the good reason that this place is awesome.  Mix of various cuisines that change regularly, perfect place for dinner before a show or whatnot.
* Coco's Outback (Thorbeckeplein 8, on Rembrandtplein): If you ever want to watch a random sporting event this is the best place in Amsterdam to do it!  Acceptable food and drink specials, often have special food/drink specials for particular events (they do a good chili cheese dog during American-football Sunday nights for example, and they're one of the only places in Amsterdam to serve North American-style chicken wings).
* Burger Bar has a location here, right across the street from the Tuschinski theater.
* Ponte Arcari (Herengracht 534): Lovely little Italian place. Nice for a date. The manager/owner is very friendly, and their ravioli special is delicious.
* Cafe Schiller (Rembrandtplein 24): Cute cafe with restaurant/full dining area, hidden away so there aren't too many tourists (they won't let you eat cake from the restaurant area in the cafe area though).

###Drinks

* Door 74 (http://www.door-74.com/#!contact/c1l96): Speakeasy style cocktail bar, you call ahead for a reservation and knock on a random door on the street and are let in.  Classy place (i.e. not cheap, €10 cocktails) but VERY cool and tasty, so it's worth the experience on a special occasion!
* Cafe Schiller (listed above) has a bar/cafe area.

## Spui

### Food
* Kantjil en de Tijger (Spuistraat 291-293): Huge Indonesian food restaurant. We recommend getting a rijsttafel.

### Drinks

* Beertemple (Nieuwezijds Voorburgwal 250): American beer bar owned by the same guy who owns Arendsnest. Great quality American craft beers, including lots of IPAs.
* Biercafe Gollem a.k.a. Gollem 1 (Raamsteeg 4): Tiny (gezellig) beer bar with many wonderful delicious Dutch- and Belgian-style beers. 

## Leidseplein (including southern Canal Belt)

### Food
* Los Pilones (Tex-Mex-type food) has a location here.
* Addis Ababa Restaurant (Overtoom 337): Good authentic Ethiopian food. Vegetarian-friendly. Abbie recommends getting a combination plate.

### Drink
* Whiskycafe L&B, a.k.a. The Whiskey Bar (Korte Leidsedwarsstraat 82-84): As the name implies, they have a huge whiskey selection.
* De Zotte (Raamstraat 29): Belgian beer bar with a good selection, they have proper food here too.
* The Waterhole (Korte Leidsewarsstraat 49): God help you it's late at night, and you're on Leidseplein.  What to do, where to go?! Well if you're already invested it turns out this place has decent live music and a cheap cover charge, and the beer isn't too bad for the area.  Can be a fun night if the night is going that way.
* Gollem's Proeflokaal a.k.a. Gollem 3 (Overtoom 160-161): Restaurant and beer bar with a huge selection of good beers, but typically packed on weekend nights.

## Plantage

### Food
* De Burgermeester (Plantage Kerklaan 37, opposite the Artis entrance): Fastfood-style place with some of the best hamburgers in Amsterdam. They tend to have a variety of burgers: beef, lamb, chicken, fish, and veggie. No fries, but the burgers are so big that you'll probably be plenty full.
* Cafe Loetje (Ruyschstraat 15): THE BEST steaks in Amsterdam!!  Also has a location near Vondelpark.

## Indische Buurt / Zeeburg / Dapperbuurt

### Food
* De Polder: On the Science Park campus next to the office in the metal half-pipe dome thing. They have good fried snacks, lunch options, dinner options, and beer/drinks.
* Thai Tiger (Javaplein 7a): Great Thai food! Not too pricey and quite delicious; good place to go with friends. They also do take-out.
* Badhuis Javaplein (Javaplein 21): Nice cafe/restaurant, good for lunch, dinner, and/or drinks. Huge patio area in nice weather!
* Bedford-Stuyvesant Cafe (Javastraat 55): Cute American-style coffeebar that focuses on sustainable/organic food and drink. They also serve breakfast and lunch, and they have some outdoor tables for summertime. The interior decor is also pretty cool!

### Drink
* Brouwerij 't IJ (Funenkade 7): Colloquially known by APIs as "The Windmill", this place brews their own beer. A favourite of the institute. No food beyond cheese/salami/peanuts, and closes at 8pm.
* East of Eden (Linnaeusstraat 11a): The former API hangout place. Nice atmosphere, good drinks.
* Amsterdam Roest B.V. (Czaar Peterstraat 213-B): Tricky to find, but very cool. Fun bar/cafe/ dancehall with an outdoor beach in the summer and fun events in the huge warehouse nextdoor.
* Walter's (Javastraat 42): Cute, semi-hipster new bar on Javastraat. They serve Brouwerij 't IJ beer here, and their small food menu has things like great burgers and standard bar snacks.

## De Pijp

### Food
* Due Napoletani (Hobbemakade 61-63): Fantastic, true Italian restaurant ran by Italian people. You have to try the pasta al parmigiano. Good Italian wines and true Italian food.
* La Vallade (Ringdijk 23): Excellent fancy French-ish food. Very nice place for a date or to take parents. They have a set menu for the day, so call ahead if you have any dietary restrictions. Reservations are highly recommended, as is going for the full 5 courses (you can opt for 3 courses instead of 5 courses, but then you'd miss the cheese platter). 5 course meal was something like €35 per person (as of late 2013).
* Desa (Ceintuurbaan 103): Good Indonesian food! Get the rijsttafel. Very friendly service. Good place to take visitors.
* India Roti Room (Eerste Oosterparkstraat 69): Fantastic Indian food, endorsed by an Indian former-API. Relatively inexpensive. There's space for larger groups, but call ahead. And, they have a restaurant cat.

## Takeaway
* [Thuisbezorgd](http://www.thuisbezorgd.nl/en/): They have an app and a website. It's a compilation of takeaway food for wherever you're located -- automatically updates based on what's open.  Very useful, and you can sort by cuisine too.
* Goulash@Home (06-16394750): No physical location but if you call them, in a half hour they will deliver amazing Hungarian goulash complete with Turkish bread and sour cream/extra spice if you want it.  They do veggie but I (Yvette) always go for the meat one, so I know it runs €7 for a one person portion, €12 for two (as of early 2014).

fields.name: windows-printing-setup
fields.text:
Installing a UvA Printer for windows:

Enable LPR printing 
  [as per this example](http://kb.linksys.com/Linksys/GetArticle.aspx?docid=46cc343ea7304fb0b338d71ae8d3c94b_Setting_up_LPR_Printing_on_Windows_Windows_7.xml&pid=80),
but in step 5, "Create new port", choose an "LPR port"

Add LPR port, set address = uvaprint.uva.nl  port = p005205
[similar port as shown in this guide](http://staff.science.uva.nl/~kholshei/linux_guide/)

Then, with 'Have disk', install driver downloaded from:
 [Oce web page per 2014](http://downloads.oce.com/ProductDownloads/Index/295)
fields.html:

Enable LPR printing as per this example, but in step 5, "Create new port", choose an "LPR port"

Add LPR port, set address = uvaprint.uva.nl port = p005205 similar port as shown in this guide

Then, with 'Have disk', install driver downloaded from: Oce web page per 2014
